00042 class NMFMultiplicativeDivergenceUpdate

00044  public:

00068   template<typename MatType>
00069   inline static void WUpdate(const MatType& V,
00070                             arma::mat& W,
00071                             const arma::mat& H)
00072   {
00073     // Simple implementation left in the header file.
00074     arma::mat t1;
00075     arma::rowvec t2;
00076 
00077     t1 = W * H;
00078     for (size_t i = 0; i < W.n_rows; ++i)
00079     {
00080       for (size_t j = 0; j < W.n_cols; ++j)
00081       {
00082         // Writing this as a single expression does not work as of Armadillo
00083         // 3.920.  This should be fixed in a future release, and then the code
00084         // below can be fixed.
00085         //t2 = H.row(j) % V.row(i) / t1.row(i);
00086         t2.set_size(H.n_cols);
00087         for (size_t k = 0; k < t2.n_elem; ++k)
00088         {
00089           t2(k) = H(j, k) * V(i, k) / t1(i, k);
00090         }
00091 
00092         W(i, j) = W(i, j) * sum(t2) / sum(H.row(j));
00093       }
00094     }
00095   }
00096 
00110   template<typename MatType>
00111   inline static void HUpdate(const MatType& V,
00112                             const arma::mat& W,
00113                             arma::mat& H)
00114   {
00115     // Simple implementation left in the header file.
00116     arma::mat t1;
00117     arma::colvec t2;
00118 
00119     t1 = W * H;
00120     for (size_t i = 0; i < H.n_rows; i++)
00121     {
00122       for (size_t j = 0; j < H.n_cols; j++)
00123       {
00124         // Writing this as a single expression does not work as of Armadillo
00125         // 3.920.  This should be fixed in a future release, and then the code
00126         // below can be fixed.
00127         //t2 = W.col(i) % V.col(j) / t1.col(j);
00128         t2.set_size(W.n_rows);
00129         for (size_t k = 0; k < t2.n_elem; ++k)
00130         {
00131           t2(k) = W(k, i) * V(k, j) / t1(k, j);
00132         }
00133 
00134         H(i,j) = H(i,j) * sum(t2) / sum(W.col(i));
00135       }
00136     }
00137   }
00138 };
